e4: Maintaining a policy of intentionally biased earnings, even if understood by sophisticated investors, is unethical and potentially risky.  Switching to unbiased reporting promotes transparency and long-term trust with all investors. While there may be short-term market adjustments, the benefits of ethical financial reporting outweigh the potential temporary disruption.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes accuracy, transparency, and fairness.  It provides a complete and unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, ensuring all investors have access to the same information. This means avoiding intentional manipulation or distortion of data and clearly communicating any assumptions or methodologies used in reporting.  Moreover, the policy should be consistently applied and subject to appropriate oversight and review.
e6: Yes, I would have some follow-up questions for management. Primarily, I'd want to understand their plan for communicating the policy change to investors and mitigating potential short-term market volatility. Additionally, I'd inquire about any legal counsel they have sought regarding the transition and whether there are strategies to minimize the risk of negative reaction from retail investors.
